entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 5:31AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: Gusty northerly winds will be the theme across the Alaska Peninsula over the next several days. Sustained winds are forecast on the order of 30 to 40 mph with potential gusts up to 50 mph, especially out of the bays and passes. Ocean effect snow showers will frequent the peninsula. Cold Bay and King Cove are expected to see periods of blowing snow and reduced visibility through

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 5:31AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: Gusty northerly winds will increase in coverage across the Kuskokwim Delta on Sunday with periods of blowing snow and reduced visibility anticipated. The strongest winds, initially along the coast this morning, are expected to expand north and east through tonight. Wind gusts are forecast to range anywhere from 35 mph to as high as 45 mph in some areas. Despite no precipitation,

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches across the northern half of the Salt River and Wyoming ranges. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 6:54PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty west to northwest wind from tonight into Sunday morning... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...West to northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts 40 to 50 mph, with locally higher winds in the mountain areas. * WHERE...Eastern sides of the Absaroka and Wind River Mountains

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 6:54PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty southwest wind from tonight into Sunday morning... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts 40 to 50 mph. * WHERE...Central Wyoming from Beaver Rim and Crooks Mountain eastward to Casper and Casper Mountain.
